title: My CatPots by MaxSRarity
description: A cute little cat-themed game that I had the opportunity to contribute during the freelancing apprenticeship period. It was a fun project to work on, and I learned a lot about how to effectively manage user data in a game.

title: Tile Cat - Triple Match Puzzle by MaxSRarity
description: Another cat-themed game that I contributed during the freelancing apprenticeship period. It was a big opportunity to learn how to make a level design tool and manage levels data effectively.

title: Swing!
description: The first game that I published on Google Play Store, and the first game whose quality that I truly cared about and not just make it looks like another prototype

title: Press on them MEMES
description: The second app that I published on Google Play Store, it is more like a fun project and an app that I wish actually existed

title: Tactics age by Offline Strategy Games
description: One of the freelancer's most important games and I got to work on it for some time, I learned how to make a skills and attribute system while working on this game

title: Heroes Tactic - formation war by Offline Strategy Games
source: The first game that the freelancer let me work on, it's the first experience that I had with a turn-based game
description: a

title: Mummy maze by Offline Strategy Games
source: Another game that I worked on during the apprenticeship period, my main role in this game was to make a tool/algorithm to solve and also to generate levels for this classic game, I was proud of myself for being able to think of an algorithm that does exactly what we need
description: a

title: RE Organization website
description: The first web application that I ever worked on. Overall I'm really suprised that I'm able to make a website with no prior knowledge about how to make web applications (I was just copy and pasting code from Bootstrap's documents)

title: Weirdest zombie game ever made
description: The first game that I was attempting to make a "full" game of and spent a lot of time on it, it turned out great and I really loved it.

title: Zombie Defense
description: This is a game that I have to make in 3 days to finish the training program at Madpoly Studio - VNG. I'm surprised that I can do this much in 3 days and how far I have come.

title: LAN version of PONG (1972)
description: This is a fun little project that I just wanted to make after doing the Socket programming project at University.

title: Program that solve mazes from bitmap images
description: A little project that I decided to make after a shower thought, I was like "I know A*, I know how to access the data in a bitmap file, why not combine both?"

title: Recreate the main mechanic of Portal (Valve)
description: A project that I wanted to make after finishing both Portal games, I thought it will be challenging and sure it was

title: Recreate the main mechanic of SuperLiminal
description: Although I didn't play the game, I watched enough youtube videos about it to have the motivation to make it. It was not as challenging as the Portal one, but it sure was fun to make.

title: Simulate the A* path finding algorithm in Minecraft
description: This is one of the most difficult projects that I ever worked on, not because of the A* algorithm, but because of the limitation of Minecraft's command "language", it works differently from any programming languages. And I think I'm the first person to ever make simulate A* in Minecraft's new command block system (1.13 and above)

title: Simulate the Wilson maze generating algorithm in Minecraft
description: After simulating a maze solving algorithm in Minecraft, why not simulate a maze generating algorithm too?

title: Mummy maze level solver
description: This is the algorithm that I talked about in the "Mummy maze by Offline Strategy Games", this was undoubtedly the hardest project that I've ever worked on, there is very little if not non-existent information about a Mummy maze solver online, and I'm not talking about Theseus and the minotaur maze problem (it has way fewer mechanic than mummy maze). But after some months, I think it is not so hard if I truly understood what A* is (it's not a path-finding algorithm, it's a solution-finding algorithm)

title: Minecraft's replica
description: Minecraft is actually the reason I started programming, so why not make a replica of the game that had such an impact on me?

title: Flappy bird's replica
description: The famous Vietnamese game that took the world by storm, who wouldn't want to make a replica of it?

title: An 3D graphics engine with ASCII renderer
description: I did not make this entirely by myself but followed a 4-videos series by the YouTuber javidx9, but the ASCII rendering part is my own. Through this project, I learned what graphics card was doing behind the scene mathematically with the vertex and fragment shader when you are coding on a graphics library (OpenGL, DirectX, ...)

title: Simulate Inverse Kinematic
description: After learning the basics of OpenGL through the Youtuber The Cherno, I wanted to make a project to summarize what I have learned, and simulating inverse kinematic using the FABRIK algorithm was just that.

title: Simple Steganography demonstration using LSB technique
description: After watching a video on this topic on the Computerphile channel, I thought it would be fun to make a project to demonstrate it.

title: Course registration project
description: A project I have to make during the Java application course to show what I've learned about the Hibernate library - An ORM library that helps you to create a database schema and manage your data in Java. To be honest I didn't like it because the setup with the XML files is a bit tedious.

title: Chat application
description: Another chance for me to practice my Socket programming skills, and I am proud of this project because I only made it in 8 days (the teacher gave us about a month) but I got a perfect score.

title: Todo App with Firebase
description: A project I made with 2 other teammates during the Mobile Application course, it was a fun experience because we just added as many features as we possibly can but still got a good score. The only setback is that Android Studio's performance is not very desirable.

title: One more review
description: A project I made with 4 other teammates during the Introduction to Software Engineering course, I learned a lot about the software process and what documents people write when they are developing softwares.

title: Four nations coffee
description: A project I made with 3 other teammates during the Web Application Course. Finally, I know how to make a website the correct way, even though it was just basic HTML/CSS/JavaScript and simple NodeJS, ExpressJS, I was happy with it because I know web development will not be my main career.

title: Portfolio website
description: Recursion
